contentencoded: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has voted to change the way money market funds work. More on that decision. Plus, more on a new study shows that women and minority leaders tend to be punished for focusing on diversity, while white men are rewarded for the same behavior. Also, with the influx of young migrants detained at the Southwest border this year, we take a look at the countries from which most are fleeing: Honduras, Guatemala, and El Salvador.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday July 24, 2014
teaser: Changing money market funds, punishment for hiring diversity, and young migrants from Central America.
title: PODCAST: Breaking the glass ceiling
description: Changing money market funds, punishment for hiring diversity, and young migrants from Central America.
